35885509.review:
通关撒花，恐怖传奇3：黑暗之城，A社的作品看起来大同小异，女主人公，配上一个善恶分明的剧本，点击寻物解谜穿插着一些小游戏，就能够源源不断的衍生出一个又一个系列。非常高产的发行商，而且配有简体中文。

游戏共6章，除此之外还有一个额外章节，故事发生在游戏本体结束之后。过场动画有种五毛特效的感觉，寻物结束以及切换场景时还会出现几秒钟的加载黑屏。这类型的游戏乍接触会觉得很有意思，但如果没有高质量的剧本与美工，就会沦为一般。

复活与死亡，梦魇与黑暗，失忆与追查，剧本里永远离不开这些充满戏剧性的元素。恐怖传奇是一个系列，在A社的作品里还算是过得去的水准。寻物解谜爱好者可以自行判断是否符合自己的口味，玩多了这个类型的游戏，其实都是差不多的。

Le moins bon de la trilogie. J'ai beaucoup aimé Grim Legends 1 et 2 mais je vais mettre une évaluation négative à ce 3 qui n'a pour lui que de plus jolies cinématiques.
La version française est très mauvaise, elle semble sortir tout droit d'un traducteur de première génération. Entre les simples fautes, les contresens et une concordance des temps tirée aux dés, suivre l'histoire en devient pénible. Dommage car le scénario est plutôt sympa dans sa catégorie. De plus quelques SOC s'en ressentent, le but de ce type de jeu n'étant pas de cliquer au hasard ou en conjecturant sur d'éventuels contresens, homonymies et autres approximations.
Certains mini-jeux reviennent trop souvent pour rester intéressants.
Si le niveau des énigmes reste correct pour un jeu d'objets cachés donc pas bien difficile, je les ai trouvées plus directes que dans les précédents épisodes. Personnellement je trouve ça moins satisfaisant.

Moyen moins.

33945413.review:
I bought Grim Legends 3: The Dark City in a Bundle a while ago and I don't regret it. 

Before we Start the Review let me say that you don't have to play the first or the second one as all of the stories are not connected with each other and the main characters seems to be different as well.

Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is an amazing Point & Click / HO Game made by inhouse Artifex Mundi. The Artwork is great and the atmosphere amazing as always! This Game unlike the second one has great Voice Actors and amazing Animation.

Story Wise the game took me immediatly in its ban and it reminded me a little tiny bit on Assassins Creed which I personally loved even more.

This Game also comes with the Collectors Edition although it does not say so on Steam. This means it comes with a Soundtrack, Artwork and Wallpapers up to 1080x1920! And ofcourse a little Bonus Story.

The Puzzles in this game felt rather easy compared to number 2 however it had some math puzzles again that were this time not to hard but not to easy either.

One thing that is different which I have so far not seen in any of these type of games before is that in the end you actually can choose between to options. Actually quiet impressive in my honest opinion. I havent played the game a second time yet so I dont know if the other choice made a different impact.

All in all I loved this Game and am still wishing that there could be another one that continues this Story.

I do recommend this game to everybody that likes Hidden Object / Point and Click Games and to every Achievement Hunter.

However due to it being so short I recommend you get it on Sale.

32928482.review:
[b]The Dark City jest już trzecią częścią świetnej serii Grim Legends przy, której można bawić się naprawdę wyśmienicie.[/b]

[h1]OPRAWA[/h1]
Podczas rozgrywki przemierzymy aż 36 lokacji, które utrzymane są w mrocznym (jak przystało na serię) klimacie. Oczywiście każda z nich jest ręcznie rysowana, co stało się już wizytówką studia Artifex Mundi, to właśnie ten zabieg nadaje każdej produkcji niepowtarzalnego klimatu, który jest tak naprawdę nieodłączną częścią opowieści. Prawie zawsze podczas gry zwracam uwagę na to, czy twórcy zwrócili uwagę na szczegóły i postanowili je dopracować i tutaj się nie zawiodłem, wszystko jest pięknie wkomponowane w otoczenie i utrzymane w tym samym stylu. Animacje wyglądają bardzo naturalnie, więc tak naprawdę nie mam się do czego przyczepić. Udźwiękowienie jest świetnie dopasowane do panującego klimatu co tylko potęguje tajemniczość całej gry.

[h1]FABUŁA[/h1]
Wcielamy się w członkinie zakonu mającego w posiadaniu artefakt, w którym zamknięta jest potężna siła mogąca zniszczyć cały świat, oczywiście wyznawcy ciemności chcą go odzyskać, co niestety im się udaje. Na naszych rękach spoczywa odpowiedzialność za całą ludzkość, musimy odzyskać artefakt, jednak nie będzie to takie proste. Po ukończeniu głównej przygody możemy zagrać w bonusową historię.

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
I niestety na tym etapie zaczynają się schody. Będziemy musieli przejść przez wiele łamigłówek, z czego każda jest inna i wymaga trochę innego myślenia. Sceny z ukrytymi obiektami... prawie wszystkie były bardzo przyjemne, poza jedną gdzie musimy znaleźć element (metalową obręcz), która jest przedstawiona jako zupełnie inny przedmiot (z tego co pamiętam było to coś w stylu deski), i nagle przy ostatniej scenie możesz stracić szansę na osiągnięcie, żeby nie używać podpowiedzi, dzięki temu, że przez [u]nienaprawiony błąd gry[/u] puszczą Ci nerwy, powinno to być naprawione jednak do dzisiaj bardzo utrudnia rozgrywkę. Druga sprawa, czasem nie zostają zaliczone osiągnięcia, w moim przypadku przeszedłem grę na poziomie ekspert i teraz muszę robić to jeszcze raz bo gra sprawiła mi psikusa...

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Pomimo dwóch bardzo denerwujących błędów gra się przyjemnie, szczególnie w tak pięknym otoczeniu jakie stwarzają lokacje.

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓRZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Piękna grafika
+ Przyjemne udźwiękowienie
+ Wciągająca opowieść
+ Kilka poziomów trudności
+ Łamigłówki
+ Tajemniczy klimat
+ Ładne animacje
+ Elementy kolekcjonerskie

- Zbugowane osiągnięcia
- W dalszym ciągu nienaprawiona scena HO

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

32354590.review:
PC Steam

Duration: almost 4 hours.

This is an excellent HOPA.  The opening prologue is some of the best HOPA I've ever played.  It sets up a wonderful atmosphere, voice acting is good, animations are effective and puzzles are intuitive with some good variety.  

The prologue had a bit of a detective puzzle sequence, which unfortunately wasn't used elsewhere in the game. This was a pity as it created an expectation that wasn't met.  The length was just about right for immersion, although the final two "chapters" felt quite short. 

This has to be one of my favourite HOPAs ever and rivals Enigmatis 2.

32329058.review:
This is probably my favorite of the three "Grim Legends" titles that exist. It has a great story, nice visuals, a variety of puzzles and is a decent length. The bonus chapter is also fun to play (although short), so it's an added bonus. 

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*] The puzzles in this game are decent in variety and aside from a few that felt really frustrating, they weren't that hard to complete. They make you think, but not TOO hard and don't have you stressing out that you might have to skip them and forfeit your "skip no puzzles" achievement if you're going for that. Some puzzle games have puzzles that I get totally stumped on or spend 20-30 minutes on, but luckily, this is not the case here! 

[*] The HOP vary with "find 12 of this object" to the usual "find everything in the list." There were more puzzles than HOPs, so although I feel there could have been more, there's still a decent number to balance it all out.

[*] The dark and moody atmosphere of the game went well with the overall tone of the game's story. It's dark and stylish, and every area is enjoyable to look at. 

[*] Some of these games are really grueling to play on Expert, but this one is pretty forgiving. They don't change the puzzle solutions (or make them more difficult) on a higher difficulty like in some games, and they give you just enough room that you probably know where to go back and check without getting lost. 

[*] As mentioned above, the bonus chapter is pretty fun. It features some of my favorite visuals in the game, and although it is short, it's very enjoyable. Most of these types of games have a bonus chapter but they are often feel rushed or just aren't very exciting, so this was a welcomed change. 
[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*] The timed puzzle are by far the WORST part of the entire game. I don't like to feel rushed, and I also don't like to miss achievements. "Solve a HOP in 20 seconds" is by far the most grueling, and there are very little chances to get it. I enjoyed the mirror puzzles, but solving them in under 3 minutes felt stressful, especially as they scaled up in difficulty. If you fail to solve these time based puzzles in the time limit, you will have to play through the game a second time and try again.

[*] The collectible based achievement is also missable, which I find to be a total pain in the neck. There are 30 of them in all, but if you miss one in an area that you can no longer go back to, you will once again have to restart the game once you've finished it. Tracking is poor too; there's no way to tell which ones you've missed. The only way to tell is by restarting and seeing that you've already collected that doll when nothing shows up on the screen. So it doesn't make you re collect everything, but it doesn't help much, as you will still have to go through the game with a fine toothed comb. I highly recommend using a guide if you are trying to track down all 30 skeleton doll thingies. 

[*] I found two spelling errors, which sort of bugged me. Artifex Mundi didn't start making these games yesterday, you know? They are minor and not very distracting though.
[/list]

31748517.review:
[h1]Závěr trilogie jinak[/h1]
První dva díly této série byly úžasné. V Artifex Mundi převzali klasické pohádky, přidali pár vlastních prvků a ono to fungovalo na jedničku. I proto jsem neváhal a koupil si tento díl. Má očekávání byla velká, nejspíše až příliš. Hlavní slabinou GL3 je příběh. Je nudný, lehce předvídatelný a strašně béčkový. Dal by se popsat jako mix Van Helsinga a Assassins Creed. Jste členkou tajného řádu, který loví monstra. Zív.

Příběh nenabízí nic neviděného v předchozích hrách od AM a je to škoda. Místo další vlastní verze nějaké klasické pohádky se tu více experimentovalo a je to spíše na škodu. Dokonce ani příběh v doplňkovém dobrodružství není nic extra a je překvapivě nelogický. Vyzradit více nemůžu, jelikož je to obrovský spoiler.

[h1]Jako malůvka[/h1]
Titul naštěstí zachraňuje audiovizuální zpracování, které je opět vyvedeno na jedničku. Hlavně po grafické stránce se je čím kochat. Bohužel i co se týče hádanek, mám pár výtek. Pět vzpomínkových by bylo zajímavých, jenže díky špatnému zpracování jsou těžší a ne moc zábavné. Zbytek hádanek je v pořádku, ale poté narazíte i na HOG scény. Zde je problém mnohdy rozeznat, co máte hledat, jelikož to sem tam má jiný tvar, než jaký je zobrazen. Také díky grafické stylizaci jsem měl problémy s rozeznáním některých předmětů.

Možná je chyba u mě, ale ani onu hádankovou část jsem si nějak extra neužil. Pak tu na vás čeká pár soubojů, které jsou dobře zpracované, ale jelikož nejsou na čas, tak jsou dětsky jednoduché.

[h1]Špatný závěr trilogie[/h1]
Shnilou třešničkou na konec je fakt, že hromada achievementů vyžaduje větší píli v jejich získání, tudíž hru budete muset projet několikrát (hádanky musíte splnit na čas nebo bez jediné chyby). Pokud bych tento titul srovnal s Enigmatis 3 nebo Nightmares from the Deep 3, dopadne rozhodně nejhůře. A i když byl tento titul pro mě osobně zklamáním, dokážu jej doporučit fanouškům HOG žánru. Po báječném druhém dílu působí tahle hra ale spíše jako studená sprcha.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ audiovizuální zpracování
+ některé hádanky jsou dost zajímavé a i těžší
+ pár nových prvků v HOG žánru
+ souboje a místy akčnější pojetí

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- trapný a lehce předvídatelný příběh
- odklon od pohádek
- vzpomínkové hádanky jsou díky průsvitnosti těžší a ne moc zábavné
- HOG scény jsou mnohdy méně kvalitní
- celé doplňkové dobrodružství nedává smysl

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 6,5/10[/b]

Tuhle hru jsem kupoval ihned po dokončení druhého dílu a ten propad v kvalitě je obrovský. Někomu tahle tématika může sednout, já bych ale spíše ocenil další temnější pohádku.

В общем.
Мы девушка-мега-супер-крутой-ассасин-безкредо.
А еще у нас анимированное меню. Не в смысле очередная молния бахает и русалка шлепает по лужице, а прям круто рассматриваем куда мы напрыгали (тельце на крыше стоит, вот).
А дальше мы бежим, у нас крадут какую-то хурму, [strike]звоним в милицию и ждем пока все расследуют[/strike] бежим разбираться с этим чудо-вором, по дороге появляется бородач и говорит, чтобы мы были осторожны. Без проблем, батя!
Но в конце концов нас отдубасивает молодой человек и кража уже 100% совершена (даже можем свидетельствовать об этом в отделении). 
ШОЖЕДЕЛАТЬ?
Играть.
Игра оооочень красивая. Красивые локации, нарисованные персонажи, сама атмосфера пропитана чуть-чуть вахой, дьяблой и "покайся, грешница!".

Пара смертей есть. 
Ну и любовь-морковь, но не для нашей ГГ. Что радует. *Надеюсь ромфанки с лит-эры не додумаются никогда писать сценарии к таким казуалкам.*
Так что 9/10 злоябучих высших целей их миллиарда иных сценариев.

31109035.review:
Much better than its predecessors, so much so that if you've not played any of them, this is the one to play (though they are numbered, the stories do not follow each other).

The production quality, for one, is quite good with excellent art direction and actual 3D cutscenes.  The 2D sprites that typically talk to you in a Mundi title still utilize the warping technique, but it's stylized enough that the creepy factor is much lower than normal.  In any case, it seems lessons were learned and Grim Legends finally hits its stride (3rd time's a charm).

What makes GL3 good is that anyone who typically plays these games on the Expert level will find a good challenge here instead of the cakewalk you're used to.  The achievements present actual challenges this time (I suck at that last mirror puzzle) and there's no "HEY, THE HIDDEN THING IS HERE" stuff going on, so you'll need to keep your eyes peeled.  The HOGs are still focused affairs, having you either find pieces of a whole or singular items with varying levels of interactivity.  Trying to complete one in 20 seconds is tough, even if you know where everything is.  Achievement hunters have their work cut out on this one and that absolutely makes this one a lot more engaging to play.

The story itself is a bit of a stray as well; this time you're not a mom or a daughter trapped in a weird situation - no, you're a badass monster hunting woman who's out to stop evil from eviling!  Look, these games don't typically blow you away with their stories (which is weird, because I would think that this would be an excellent genre to tell great stories), but this one tries something new.

On the downside, even fewer find-the-random-objects puzzles appear (two, if I recall correctly), putting this game pretty much in the adventure category, so if you're more of the traditionalist when it comes to HOGs, then you may be disappointed.  Some of the achievements are also bugged or require an entire playthrough to pick up if you mess it up the first time, but this title is also probably one of the shortest ones I've played from the Mundi library.  Normally I'll clock in around 3-4 hours for a single playthrough (coz I'm a filthy casul), but I've manged to play through it 3 times in that time.  The game just suddenly ends, though not in a disappointing way, but it's worth noting that the romp is over quite fast.

Anyways, this is a good one and an example of the Mundi goodness fans expect.

30898605.review:
[h1]Short version: 91%[/h1]
Unlike its predecessors, Dark City borrows more from the action fantasy version of Van Helsing than from fairy tales. Sadly, this resulted in only a handful of hidden object scenes, but in return, we get a great action-oriented storyline.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Despite its title, Grim Legends 3: Dark City has nothing in common with the previous two games. It is more of a casual version of the Order 1886 or Van Helsing instead, following the adventures of Sylvia, a member of a secret order dedicated to battling supernatural threats.
Admittedly, the casual scene is not a great place for this kind of storytelling, but Dark City manages to pull this off, including action sequences, drama, and even a bit mystery involving our heroine’s foggy past—resulting in something where the plot motivates the player more than the gameplay itself.

The game also relies on this, as said gameplay is shoved into a secondary role. There are barely a handful of hidden object scenes in total, and conventional puzzles are even rarer. Sure, the point ‘n’ click gameplay is top-notch, but part of me wishes if this hidden object game would have felt more like a… well, a hidden object game.

30197443.review:
Tohle je presne ukazka, ze kdyz dva delaji totez, neni to totez. Takovouhle kresbu umeji jen v polskem Artifexu. Opravdu nadherne namalovana HOPA, ktera ma jedno velke negativum, a tim jsou neprijemne achievementy. Ale k tomu se dostanu.

Dalsim (i kdyz relativnim) minusem je, ze ackoliv se jedna o treti dil rady Grim Legends, nenachazim zadnou spojitost s pohadkami, ani od Grimmu jako v prvnich dvou dilech, ani s jinymi. Naopak se autori netradicne inspirovali popularitou serie "Assassin's Creed". Hrajete za clenku jakehosi Radu, ktery chrani svet pred demony. Obleceni, vzhled brasen a dalsi detaily, to vse okate prevzate z AC. Vypada to sice dobre, vcetne cutscen, ale ta absence pohadkovych motivu me mrzi. Tematem to zkratka nepasuje k prvnim dvema dilum.

Vsechno nastesti vyvazuje opravdu hezka a atmosfericka grafika, plna ruznych prizraku, kterym se tu rika maskobludy. Jsou to otroci Koshmaara, coz je hlavni demon, ktery je zaklet v mocnych Veznicich kamenech. Ty maji mnoho dalsich schopnosti, ovsem jejich pouzitim se riskuje prave osvobozeni Koshmaara, coz se taky stane. Vase postava je tedy takovy zensky assassin (vsechny HOPA hry jsou cileny hlavne na zeny) a spolu s mentorem Solomonem se vydavate zachranit svet.

Hudba sice neni vyrazna, ale nerusi, coz je hlavni. Puzzly jsou primerene tezke, hidden object screeny (HOS) taky. Dokonce jsou tu i "akcni" soubojove sekvence, zajimavy doplnek. Na Experta to date cca za 5-6hodin. Problem nastava, pokud chcete mit vsechny achievy. Pak budete muset projet hru 2x, coz je neblahou klasikou u Artifexu. [i]Teoreticky by se dalo hrat na Experta a pak udelat zbyvajici 1 achiev za dokonceni Tutorialu v nizsi obtiznosti. Ale pochybuji, ze vam po dohrani zbyde jen tento jeden - leda byste hrali podle navodu. Je tu totiz nekolik tezkych achievu "na cas": napr. dokoncit HOS pod 20sec se da vpodstate jen na jednom miste; skladani nekterych "zrcadel vzpominek" po zapase s maskobludou se vam take asi nepovede pod 3 minuty napoprve. Vysledkem tedy je, ze pro 100% si budete muset zahrat "GL3" znovu a navic i s navodem na tyto tezsi pasaze. Neni to RPG, cili je to opet to same a to je otrava.[/i]

Collector bonusy jsou klasicke - artworky, OST a wallpapery. Bonusova kapitola se jako vzdy neda nazvat pridavkem, protoze je logickym pokracovanim deje a bez ni to nedava smysl. Pokud budete chtit hru v CZ, musite stahovat z [url=http://www.alawarhry.cz/game/grim-legends-the-dark-city-collectors-edition/]Alawaru[/url]

Nebyt tedy nestastnych achievementu, je to prijemna a atmosfericka adventura. Skoda toho odklonu od pohadek.

[h1]70%[/h1]

[h1]Grim Legends 3: The Dark City est un excellent jeu d’objets cachés[/h1]

Le titre en français de ce jeu est Tristes Légendes 3 : La ville sombre.

Souvent les jeux d’objets cachés produit par Artifex Mundi sont en trilogie avec une histoire s’étalant sur les trois épisodes. Ici, chaque épisode de la trilogie Grim Legends est une histoire à part entière.

L’héroïne, que vous jouez, s’appelle Sylvia. Sylvia fait parti d’une organisation secrète qui combat les forces du mal cherchant à prendre pied sur notre planète.

L’histoire est bien faite. On découvre, entre autres, que certains personnages ne sont pas vraiment ce qu’il tente de donner comme image, ils portent un masque, tout simplement.

Il y a pas mal de mini-jeux (en plus de ceux avec des objets cachés) et même si certains sont difficiles, ils ne sont pas insurmontables.

Pour conclure, c’est un bon petit jeu que je conseille pour s’amuser de longues heures.

29293119.review:
Kopię gry udało mi się wygrać w konkursie na gram.pl.

Zgodnie z przewidywaniami, jakie miałem przy Grim Legends 2, trójka nijak nie spaja poprzednich tytułów w większą całość. Każda z gier zawiera osobną historię, a kolejność rozgrywania nie ma znaczenia. W GL3 wcielimy się w Sylvię, należącą do organizacji o jakże oryginalnej nazwie: The Order. Wspomniane ugrupowanie zajmuje się zwalczaniem wszelkiego rodzaju nadnaturalnych zjawisk i poczwar, a do tego pilnują uwięzionego potwora / upiora o wdzięcznym imieniu: Koshmaar. Grę rozpoczynamy w momencie, gdy musimy zbadać miejsce, w którym pojawił się jeden ze sługusów koszmarka, nazywanych maskwraith.

Dwie najbardziej zauważalne różnice w stosunku do GL2: powrót do swobody prawie równej tej z jedynki oraz brak chowańca. Zamiast niego wprowadzono „system magii”. Polega on na wskazaniu kombinacji symboli, której nie posiada przeciwnik. Trzy poprawne kliknięcia oznaczają wygraną walkę. Na tym jednak nie koniec nowości. Niektóre z rozmów zostały rozbudowane o wybór tematów (stricte kosmetyczny, ale jednak). Część przedmiotów będzie można połączyć / rozmontować w nowy sposób, kilka napotkanych obiektów obracać, co czasami stanowi łamigłówkę samą w sobie.

Pozostałe aspekty są porównywalne nie tylko z poprzednimi częściami Grim Legends, ale też grami Artifex Mundi w ogóle. Drobiazgowa grafika i płynne animacje cieszą oczy. Specyficzny klimat daje się odczuć na każdym kroku, a całości dopełnia dobrze dobrana muzyka. Gra aktorska nie przeszkadza, ale w pamięć też nie zapadnie. Końcową ciekawostką będą poziomy trudności. Do tej pory były to trzy ustawione na sztywno. W Grim Legends 3 istnieje możliwość całkowitego zmodyfikowania poziomu każdego z aspektów gry.

Żeby nie było za różowo, pora na wady. Raz na jakiś czas aplikacja potrafiła się zamknąć, ot tak, bez żadnego komunikatu o błędzie. Niektóre przedmioty w sekwencjach hidden object nie zawsze reagowały na pierwsze kliknięcie. W jednej z takich scen przedstawienie dosłownie jednego z fragmentów do znalezienia było do chrzanu. Według obrazka mamy szukać obręczy, natomiast w sekwencji wisi ona w taki sposób, że bardziej przypomina pasek ze skóry. Długość gry może być dla niektórych dyskusyjna, podobnie jak epilogowy wydźwięk dodatkowej miniprzygody.

Niemniej jednak Grim Legends 3 to solidna robota z gatunku przygodowo-hidden object. Grało mi się dużo lepiej niż w dwójkę, ale do jedynki zabrakło jej trochę uroku. Mimo to, jeśli ten rodzaj gier jest w kręgu waszych zainteresowań, warto The Dark City poświęcić czas. Moja ocena: 4.

29118491.review:
A good hidden object game.

[b][u]Positive:[/u][/b]
- The graphics are very good
- The story is quite good and original for an HO game. The ending felt a bit rushed and some details are a bit incoherent, but nothing terrible.
Be aware that the theme is very different from the previous games of the series. Since I didn't like the second episode, I had no problem with that, but some people might be disappointed.
- The puzzles are fine. I really enjoyed the memory mirrors (they look nice and put a new spin on some classic HO puzzles). The other puzzles are still the classic things you usually find in this type of game, but they are modified enough to keep them interesting. I didn't really enjoy the rune fights, though.
- Rotating objects when examining them is an interesting feature

[b][u]Average:[/u][/b]
- About half of the HO scenes require to find arbitrary shapes. I prefer finding full objects rather than pieces.
- The collectible objects were easy to find. I enjoyed not having to spend too long to find them all, but maybe that was too easy.
- Voice acting is alright. I've heard much worse.
- The music is fine: never annoying, but not memorable either.
- Some dialogs allow you to choose what topic to talk about. You still have to go through all of them so it doesn't matter, but it might be an idea to develop in future games.
- The extra chapter offers a choice which is unusual. Sadly, it hardly makes any difference (doing both is mostly for achievements).

[b][u]Negative:[/u][/b]
- Some minigames and HO scenes can't be replayed from the extra menu.
- At least one word in HO scenes has an awful translation ("arm" instead of "coat of arms"). There might be others, but I got used to bad translations in HO games so I probably forgot them.
- One of the arbitrary shape HO scene shows a circular shape, while the object in the scene is sideways and looks like a rod. It's impossible to find without a hint.

28317617.review:
Unlike the previous game in the series, Grim Legends 3 isn't based on a specific fairy tale, nor does its organization of monster hunters use fairy tales for reference and research. However, any disappointment I felt was soon forgotten as I grew immersed in the exciting, well-paced plot.

The gameplay leans more towards casual point & click than hidden object, with just a token few traditional hidden object scenes and a handful of fragmented objects, but the minigames and puzzles are nicely integrated into the story -- for example, magical combat and finding images in stained glass to reveal pieces of a narrative.

Notably for an Artifex Mundi title, the voice acting is actually good, and characters have proper 3D animations instead of that awful warping paper doll effect used in Grim Legends 2.

Of course the Big Twist is immediately obvious if you're familiar with any amnesia tropes whatsoever, but the characters were interesting enough to carry the story for me anyway, and the multiple endings [spoiler](even though they're at the very end of the bonus game and don't affect anything)[/spoiler] were a pleasant surprise.

Probably Artifex Mundi's best game so far; highly recommended to casual adventure fans.

26983843.review:
Очередной шедевр от Artifex Mundi и продолжение квестов серии Grim Legends. 
С первых минут игра нас буквально затягивает своей музыкой и атмосферой, дополняя это неплохими видеовставками.

Сюжет великолепный, очень интересные персонажи, каждый со своей историей. К ним быстро привыкаешь и начинаешь волноваться за них, ибо очень сильно затягивает рассказ.

Крайне много головоломок, загадок и различных поисков предметов, также присутствует поиск кукол-бесов, за нахождение которых даётся достижение. Большинство ачивок вы получите по прохождении игры, за некоторыми Вам придётся возвращаться и что-то переиграть. Впрочем, скучать Вам не придётся! 
[spoiler]Бонусная глава обязательная к прохождению, без неё Вы упустите продолжение истории и судьбу Габриэля.[/spoiler]

26286697.review:
English review (polska recenzja niżej):

Let me start this review by admitting that I'm not the greatest fan of the Artifex Mundi studio. While they have created some real awesome games (the previous installment of Grim Legends or the first part of Nightmares from the Deep saga for example ), they are also capable of releasing a game that is mediocre or worse ( most of the Time Mysteries or 9 Clues 2: The Ward). They also seem to suffer from an occasional sequel degradation, meaning the next game in the series being actually much worse than its predecessor. I believe this being the case of both mentioned earlier 9 Clues (first part being, in my opinion, much more entertaining than the sequel), Nightmares from the Deep (first being the best out of the entire trilogy) and now it seems also true for the Grim Legends 3, which is nowhere near as great as the second part of this particular series. Furthermore, many people seem to share this sentiment. If you take a look at the Steam's negative reviews section, the top rated opinions seem to share the common argument that while not a bad game, The Dark City is a disappointment. I may agree, but I don't believe that this single argument can earn Grim Legends 3 a negative review on its own. While definitely not as charming as the second part (so far my favorite Artifex Mundi game) it still is a decent and at times really good game. But let me get into more detail to justify my opinion. 

First of all the art is quite uneven. During the entire game I had not a single moment of actually stopping there for a moment just to enjoy the sights (with the possible exception of a title screen). What is more, I believe this game looks much worse than Grim Tales 2 and when finished with the story I had to visit the store pages of both games to compare the screenshots, which only strengthened me in this belief. While there can be no doubt that Artifex Mundi employ a group of very talented artists, some of the screens(especially it's second half of the game) give this "Let's just finish this ASAP and have some beer" impression. Similar with the sound, music and voice acting - nothing exceptional. To finish the paragraph on the positive note: the facial animations no longer hurt one's eyes (although, some individual, who certainly is much meaner than me, could point out that one female guard right in the beginning of the game...)

On the other hand I'm quite content with the puzzles - surprisingly creative at times. This is a very good news indeed, since oftentimes Artifex Mundi games share a number of very similar puzzles. Furthermore, the HOG sections of the game are pleasantly varied: there are at least three different kinds - with object names written at the bottom of the screen,  objects themselves displayed below or where you have to find 11 or 12 similar items. Although, mind you, there are some typical Artifex Mundi glitches like minor mistranslations or a puzzle that requires you to find a lipstick while there are two lipsticks on the screen, only one being active. At the very least, they could have bought the license to make the game play Rick Astley when the player keeps on continuously clicking the wrong one long enough. But maybe it's just me being cynical. 
 
Since you already know my opinion about this game, thanks for reading so far I guess. If it's the previous Grim Legends that got you here, and you feel like a fable-themed Artifex Mundi game you may try Eventide:Slavic Fable first. Or you might actually want to watch the Dark City, a brilliant 1998 movie starring Rufus Sewell and Kiefer Sutherland  and then, if still needed, consider playing Grim Legends 3. Oh, and also, the word „koszmar” ( with a single „a”) is a Polish word meaning „nightmare”. Now you can say that my mini-reviews have a certain educational value.

Polska recenzja:

Zacznijmy od takiego (być może mało patriotycznego, dla niektórych pewnie wręcz bluźnierczego) stwierdzenia, że nie jestem jakimś wielkim fanem Artifex'ów. Zgoda, stworzyli kilka naprawdę świetnych gier (na przykład poprzednie Grim Legends czy pierwszą część Nightmares from the Deep), ale wydali też kilka gier przeciętnych i gorzej ( większość Time Mysteries'ów, 9 Clues 2: The Ward ). Zdarza im się też że naprawdę niezła gra ma taką sobie kontynuację  - jak już wspomniałem, zupełnie mi obmierzłe 9 Clues 2, czy właśnie takie sobie Grim Legends 3 ( co jest irytujące tym bardziej że druga część tej sagi jest obecnie moją ulubioną grą studia i miałem nadzieję na dużo więcej). Dodatkowo, jeżeli spojrzeć na negatywne recenzje, wielu ludzi zarzuca tej grze że zwyczajnie nie jest tak dobra jak jej poprzedniczki. Mimo że zgadzam się z tą opinią, nie jestem przekonany że taki argument wystarczy by od razu wystawiać grze negatywa. Grim Legends 3 jest grą dobrą, a momentami bardzo dobrą. Ale, pozwólcie że uzasadnię moją opinię poniżej. 

Po pierwsze grafika – bywa różnie. Przez całą grę nawet na chwilę nie zatrzymałem się żeby zwyczajnie pogapić się na krajobrazy. No niech będzie, spodobało mi się użycie perspektywy na ekranie tytułowym, ale to tyle. Szczerze mówiąc, gra wygląda momentami dużo biedniej niż Grim Legends 2 – do tego stopnia że po jej skończeniu zajrzałem do Steamowej galerii żeby porównać zrzuty ekranu, co tylko umocniło mnie w przeświadczeniu że część druga wygląda zwyczajnie lepiej. Nie mam wątpliwości że Artifex Mundi zatrudnia niezwykle utalentowanych artystów niemniej, szczególnie w drugiej połowie gry, wiele plansz wygląda jak „ Skończmy to już rysować i chodźmy wreszcie na piwo”. Dźwięk, głosy i muzyka są tam gdzie być powinny i to tyle- nic specjalnego. Żeby zakończyć paragraf pozytywną myślą: oglądanie animacji twarzy nareszcie nie rani oczu (choć ktoś bardziej złośliwy ode mnie prawdopodobnie przyczepił by się do pewnej pani strażnik pojawiającej się na samym początku gry...).

Z drugiej strony zagadki – są zaskakująco twórcze. W mojej opinii jest to szczególnie dobra nowina w grach studia które uwielbia umieszczać ten sam rodzaj łamigłówki w każdej kolejnej grze aż do znudzenia. Do tego HOGi są przyjemnie zróżnicowane – w niektórych mamy wypisane na dole nazwy przedmiotów które musimy znaleźć, w innych pokazane są obrazki, w jeszcze innych musimy odszukać 11 czy 12 takich samych obiektów. Żeby jednak za bardzo się nie zachwycać; wersja angielska ma kilka literówek, a w pewnym momencie gra prosi o znalezienie szminki na ekranie na którym szminki są dwie. I tylko jedna działa. Osobiście uważam, że twórcy mogli przynajmniej kupić licencję i puszczać Ricka Astleya kiedy gracz będzie wystarczająco długo klikał tą niewłaściwą szminkę.

Znacie już moją opinię więc chyba dzięki za czytanie aż do tego momentu. Jeżeli (tak jak ja) kupiliście tą grę dlatego że podobały się wam poprzednie części i macie ochotę na Artifex Mundi w bajkowo – baśniowych klimatach to może powinniście najpierw spróbować Eventide: Slavic Fable – jest lepsza, a do tego przyjemnie słowiańska. Możecie też chcieć zainteresować się samym „Dark City” z 1998 roku – niesamowity film z Rufusem Sewellem i Kieferem Sutherlandem – filmu nie łączy z grą absolutnie nic poza tytułem, ale kto widział ten wie że warto. Samo Grim Legends 3 ma u mnie 6+/10 i znaczek „Kupować w bundlu”.

26132625.review:
[h1][u]Game Information[/u][/h1]

Grim Legends: The Dark City [CE*], is a HOPA* game, developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

Previous installment of this series as follows: The Forsaken Bride and Song of the Dark Swan. Please do note that there are no link between these games. They can be played in any order.

*CE - Collector's Edition
*HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

Since this is an collector's edition game, it comes with some extra features, that aren't available in the regular edition game.

[h1][u]Game Visuals[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the visuals for this game is nicely done with a painted feel. The visuals can be adjusted in the option menu.

[h1][u]Game Audio[/u][/h1]

I want to mentioned that the audio for this game is well done even if it's simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the option menu as well.

[h1][u]Gameplay[/u][/h1]

There are only four difficulty game modes to choose from: Casual,  Advanced, Expert and Custom.

Scroll Task Panel keep tracks of all game's objectives.

There are interactive items in the game. Interactive items are marked with a symbol. Most of these interactive items do require extra items before they can be interact with.

The interactive map allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates there are tasks that needs to be done at certain locations. 

Most of the hidden object scenes consists of find "x" amount, fragment items, traditional word lists with little or no interaction. Some of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra content section.

Most of the game's puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Some of the puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra content section.

Thirty different collectible skeletal dolls to find throughout the game.

There are thirty-six different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements do has some requirement before they can be unlocked. The achievements are tied to 'Game Story,' 'Hidden Object Scenes,' 'Puzzle/Mini-Games,' 'Collectibles.'

There's a bonus chapter, but it can be access, only after the main portion of the game is fully completed. The bonus chapter is sequel to the main story.

[h1][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/h1]

There are total of five different trading cards. You only get the three of those cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading card: Purchased from Steam's Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and it's Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts, I've found this game enjoyable to certain extend. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the full price.

I would also like to thank the developer for supporting Linux.

25873049.review: Another resplendant example of the genre from Artifex Mundi. Here, the developer finally cast off the shackles of the HOG stereotypes (which are either a 'dark' twist on a fairy tale or some sort of semi-magical detective investigation) to bring us an offbeat, downright gothic action-adventure that seems to take cues from Assassin's Creed and The Witcher, as you play an amnesiac novice in a mysterious order of demon hunters. Thrilling stuff, this, with plenty of exciting twists and turns. This is an example of using a tried-and-true formula to tell a new story, and actually achieves what so many bog-standard HOGs fail at: Interesting characters and storylines. Fans of steampunk-fantasy aesthetics and all things Victorian and gothic will love the crap out of this game. It's also the first of the genre I've seen with a dialogue system and moral choice systems. The production values are through the roof, as is typical of Artifex Mundi, with the art style in particular this time striking a wonderfully Victorian-gothic, but still colorful and stunning aesthetic. My one point of critique would be that this time around, the "fragmented" hidden object scenes are a bit too cluttered and hard on the eyes if you're shooting for a playthrough with no hints- too many items hidden to almost obscurity by the darkness. Other than that - superb, as usual. You really feel all the love and care these people put into their games, and if you're into HOGs, you owe them your support.

7/10.

25851007.review: Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is another great hidden object game from Artifex Mundi.  The scenary is gorgeous, as usual,  and the story kept my attention to the end.  The hidden object scenes are well done.  The items blend in well, making it a challenge to find some of them, but usually not impossible to find, although I did run across a few objects that took longer than usual to locate.   The mini puzzles were fun and just right in terms of difficulty, although there was one that I found devilishly challenging and it took me quite some time to beat it, as I try not to skip anything.  I do like the hidden collectables, as well.  I usually never manage to find them all, but I lilke the extra challenge of keeping an eye out for them.  The game loaded up just fine and ran smoothly for me.  If you like casual games with a nice story, mini puzzles, and hidden object scenes, I definitely recommend picking this game up.

25830734.review: This is another of Artifex Mundi Hidden Object Games. They're beautiful, focus more on story than hidden objects, and can be burned through in about three hours (including the bonus section). The story's necessarily a little shallow and some of the puzzles are as archaic as classic point-and-click games, but the production quality is high (the scenes themselves are lush and rich, and the animated sequences are some of the best available for this kind of game). It's short, and there's no replay, but if you're a fan of Hidden Object Games, this is a good, brief, one to play.

Sono molto dispiaciuto nell'ammettere che questa volta Artifex Mundi ha fatto un lavoro decisamente superficiale con il terzo capitolo di questa che è la serie migliore dello studio.
L'ambientazione, l'audio e la storia sono molto piacevoli, ma tutto il resto sa di porting da tablet fatto in fretta. 25810593.review:
These are all very well done, but I think too similar to one another, in terms of gameplay.  There are a lot of repeated puzzles in particular.  In terms of plot this one is so different I'm a bit at a loss as to why it is part the "Grim Legends" series.  The first one had a vaguely fairy tale/Angela Carter feeling to it.  The second was the fairy tale of the Seven Swans.  This one has nothing to do with fairy tales but seems more inspired by steam punk.  At first it was a welcome change, but as I played I found the story a bit irritating.  You play a girl with amnesia fighting against people whose sins have opened them up to being possessed by other dimensional monsters.  But your own story is rather non-existent throughout the whole thing.  Also the moral seems to be a bit based on Pandora's box.  The boy in the story causes all of the trouble by investigating the occult and not submitting to the natural order, which is a point of view I've always taken as being anti-science.

Still the game is smooth as ever and about as good as a hidden object adventure can be.  As always I wish the logic puzzles were harder versions of the same puzzles.  Scaled difficulty there would be very nice.

25427533.review:
For years now, I chronically see Steam friends playing these mysterious [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] games, which is a specific brand (if you will) of HOG (hidden object games). While at first glance, this genre seemed too casual for me, but boy I was wrong.

[b]I get it now.[/b]

After my experience I can say two things:

1. Yeah, this game is fairly 'casual', BUT
2. Man-oh-man it is addicting and sooo butter smooth to play

[b][i]Grim Legends 3: The Dark City[/i] is [i]very[/i] polished, and definatley keeps you clicking.[/b] The time flies. The storyline is a cool fairy-tale esque affair, and the puzzles are just difficult enough to keep me interested - yet never make me rage. There is something very rewarding about going through this. While this genre will never be the staple of what I play, I definately appreciate it and think highly of how well-crafted it is.

[i]Essentially, this title is a series of closely related minigames that you solve as you experiece a great story.[/i] Some are run-of-the-mill hidden obect games, BUT alot of this reminds me of classic point-and-click adventuring (without a character physically moving around the screen). You have an inventory and use it to solve puzzles. [b]Definately a great atmosphere.[/b]

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Highly polished game with stunning atmosphere and engaging story
+Very rewarding puzzle solving that is a bit addictive
+Easy to get into
+If you haven't tried one of these, you owe it to yourself to pick one up when there is a deep sale

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Definately a casual game, but great for just kicking back and enjoying the experience

[b]Get one on sale, and I bet you will find yourself smiling and really enjoying it.[/b]

25124359.review:
Pretty, pretty cool puzzles, pretty lame story.

If you're in it for the puzzles, I would totally recommend it to you. But if you're in it for a good story, move along.

Neat Things: 
* The graphics kicked it up a notch in this game. Lot's of cut scenes. 
* Everyone in the order gets the same uniform. That almost inappropriate top buttons undone for men and women alike. This matters a lot to me. 
* The puzzles and the themes to them were really cool. Everything fit into a theme (even if it was overhanded at times; like the hospital) and pleasing to the eye.
* Soundscape was pretty good. Voice acting was better than usual in this series.


Meh Things: 
* What unrealistic battles! There wasn't a time penalty for not acting quickly enough (maybe there is on super hard?). But I can't believe an enemy would just let me sit there and awkwardly pattern match. 
* The plot. Was dumb. It had potential at first, but then it just derailed in a bad way. And the ending just made me sit back and think: "did I really just sit here and play this game for this ending?" 
* The side story. There was perfect potential to side story whatever thing that made the heroine lose her memories (like, idk did she get sick? Was she injured in the line of duty? Fall off a building?? I'll never know!), instead we got something dumb. It's a theme with Grim Legends to have bad side stories. Well, their not *bad* there's just something that's obviously so much cooler and interesting, and every time we get something that is disappointing.
* This herione. Isn't that smart. She doesn't prepare well, or think ahead. I don't know if it's because she lost her memories (and that's where she got her accent from?), but, this girl.

25096158.review:
[h1]Introduction.[/h1]

Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is a Hidden Object / Puzzle Title with an interesting story about a woman named Syvlia who has lost her memory and can't recall anything prior joining an organization named The Order , a group that studies and hunts down monsters. With the guidance of her mentor Solomon , Sylvia grows to become a great asset to the order. 

As Sylvia and her mentor hunt down a monster, they comes across a dangerous adventure revealing the secrets of the order and the truth about her past.

[h1]Gameplay.[/h1]

The Game Offers Two Story Arcs. The Main one being [b]"The Dark City"[/b] and one unlockable Arc named [b]"The Ancient Stone"[/b]. Both of the stories are connected and the way to unlock the second one is by completing the Main Story. An estimated time for the completion of both stories should be around 5 to 8 hours. (Without counting achievement hunting/replaying on different difficulties).

The Game also offers 4 Sets of Difficulty levels. Casual, Advanced, Expert and Custom to let the player decide how easy they want the game to go at them. 36 Achievements to Hunt for , Many Unlockables upon game completion, Animated cutscenes with dialogue , Well made voice acting for all characters and a big variety of puzzles.

[h1]Ingame Features.[/h1]
[list]
[*]36 Achievements.
[*]30 Collectibles. (Results to an Achievement Completion.)
[*]18 Replayable Minigames.
[*]12 Hidden Object Puzzles. 
[*]12 Concept Art Showcase. 
[*]6 Cutscenes.
[*]6 Wallpapers to Download.
[*]5 Soundtracks to Download.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion.[/h1]

If you're looking for a well made Hidden Object game with Puzzle elements , great voice acting and a decent storyline. Grim Legends 3: The Dark City will most likely be a game for you. Personally, without having played many Hidden Object titles , I had lots of fun with this one. 

[i]It's worth mentioning that the game has its own standalone story and is not connected with the previous Grim Legend games.[/i]

25052582.review:
A few things in life are constants...  death, taxes and Artifex Mundi releasing awesome hidden object games.  When tasked with asking yourself if you should buy the newest AM game, the answer is normally yes..   I find myself seeking out and buying every AM game I can get my grubby little hands on... Although I'm not sure how much weight that statement holds as I currently own over 6,000 games, but it is what it is..  Grim Legends 3 is no exception, it provides an interesting story, interesting and varied puzzles and obviously hidden objects..  Not only does Artifex Mundi normally tell an amazing story, but their games are down right beautiful, hand-drawn works of art.  

[h1] The Story [/h1]

(You don't need to play the first 2 Grim Legend titles to enjoy the third one, this game has a Standalone story which is not connected to the previous games in any way, shape or form)  

You find yourself Sylvia, a woman who lost her memory a year ago, she is also a member of a monster hunting order, the Order's mission is to quell out paranormal activity/monsters/demons (no not the movie, but demons and monsters).  The start of the game has a thief stealing a  the Incarceri Stone, from the order. Sylvia along with her mentor Solomon give chase, after tracking the thief down to a place called Lichtenheim, from this point onward the fun starts..  Will Sylvia regain her forgotten memory, will she ever discover why Solomon is so secretive, and can she stop the mysterious thief before all is lost?

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The game play is familiar to those of us who play Artifex Mundi games, you solve numerous puzzles (36 of them in this game) of various types..  You also pick up items and use them to drive along the story..  The game also features hidden collectible items and a fairly relaxing soundtrack.  

[h1] Recommendation [/h1]

It's pretty obvious I'm going to recommend you pick this game up.  It lives up to the potential that AM has delivered in the past and will keep the gamer engaged and interested up to the very end.  If you're looking for a nice casual relaxed game, with a good story, beautiful artwork and a relaxing soundtrack, Grim Legends 3 is for you.  If you enjoy Hidden Object games, this is for you.. If you enjoy casually fun games this is for you..  Stop wasting time reading my review, add it to your cart and buy it immediately...  Ok.. I'm just kidding... no but seriously.. BUY IT...

24837094.review:
[h1]어둠의 전설 시리즈는 모두 명작이다.[/h1]

2016년 6월 3일에 출시되어 구입과 동시에 1회차를 하고 최근에 2회차로 도전과제를 모두 마무리 지었다.
그래픽이 보다 더 강화된 느낌이다. 다만 1챕터의 말을 탄 여자 경비병이 대화시 그래픽이 어색한거 외에는 전체적으로 깔끔하고 아름다운 색감을 자랑한다.
이전 게임에서는 후드를 쓴 사람이 꼭 게임의 원흉이고 악역이었던 반면, 여기서는 주인공이 아예 후드를 쓰고 나온다. 게임의 캐릭터가 왠지 어쌔신 크리드의 영향을 받은듯하다. 악역은 나 악역이고하고 얼굴(후반부에 악마처럼 생긴 녀석이 있으니 해보면 알 것이다)을 드러내놓고 등장한다.;;

숨은그림찾기는 이전 게임들에 비하면 대폭 축소되었고 도전과제 중 숨은그림을 20초에 내에 모두 찾으라는 것이 있는데 이건 미리 알고 플레이에 임해야 한다. 20초가 짧기때문에 보자마자 곧바로 클릭해야 한다. 다행스럽게도 1쳅터의 첫번째 숨은그림찾기의 경우 찾아야 하는 아이템 목록이 그때마다 랜덤하지 않고 할때마다 찾는 아이템 목록이 같기때문에 이 숨은그림찾기 퍼즐에서 이 도전과제를 마무리하는게 좋다. 

본 게임에서 조금 발전된거 중에 하나는 아이템을 발견시 아이템 살펴보고 두가지 아이템을 합치거나 추가 액션으로 작동시키는 기능이 생겼다. 미니게임은 이전과 비슷한 수준이다.

본 게임의 옥의 티는 번역 오류가 다소 있는데, 해골 색깔 바꾸는 미니게임할때 힌트의 설명이 잘못되었다는 점.
인접한 해골간에 색깔을 달리 해야 하는 미니게임인데, 힌트 설명의 번역이 잘못된걸 알수 있다.
그리고 주인공의 선배 캐릭터인 할배(이름 생각안난다;;)의 경우 높임말을 썼다가 반말했다가 인물간의 상황설정에서 잘못되었다. 선배 캐릭터인 만큼 아래사람한테 반말을 하는게 대화가 메끄러울거같은데 그런 번역상의 문제가 아쉽다. 그것만 제외하고는 전체적으로는 괜찮은 수준이다.

본편의 경우 게임을 엔딩 볼려면 3~4시간 정도 소요되는데 스토리도 짧지도 않고 너무 길지도 않은 적당한 수준이다.
도전과제는 본편을 플레이하고 보너스 스토리까지 플레이해야 모든 도전과제가 언락이 가능하다.
보너스 스토리까지 포함해서 1회차로 모든 도전과제를 언락할수도 있지만 그럴려면 모든걸 다 알고 플레이에 임해야 하기 때문에 1회차로 도전과제를 모두 언락하기는 쉽지않은 편이다.
특히 거울 미니게임 중 다섯번째 미니게임은 해당 시간 안에 맞춰야 하기 때문에 생각보다 어렵다.
하다보면 시간 초과가 되는 경우가 많기 때문이다.

전체적으로 잘 만들어진 편이고 본 게임의 시리즈는 다른 시리즈 (에니그메티스, 심해의 악몽)과는 조금 다르게 각각 편들이 스토리가 연결되지 않고 별도의 독립된 스토리들이다. 주인공 또한 1,2,3편 모두 다른 인물들이다. 아마도 4, 5편이 나올 가능성도 있을 것으로 보인다.

69번째 도전과제 100% 달성한 게임.
(2016년 8월 9일 오후 9시 16분에 달성)

24506496.review:
This might be my new favourite HOG.

You are Sylvia, a member of the Order which fights paranormal things to protect the world against evil. Monsters start appearing in the city and you have to find out why and how to stop them. 

The game's story is in no way connected to the two previous Grim Legends games, and I'm not sure why this is in the same series as this has less of a folktale feeling to it. This should be in its own series imo. Please. 

Good innovative puzzles and interesting twist on classic ones; interesting plot with decent twists, good graphics and voices all around (the main character is British for a change), well placed achievements, no bugs or glitches. The monsters are really neat-looking and well made. The HO scenes aren't that many or overwhelming, so someone who's not a fan of the genre may still want to try it as a point-and-click/adventure game.

The setting has a feel of Assassin's Creed or Batman over them, though of course slightly more feel-good and colourful, though the story is still fairly.. well, grim. There are bossfights and a finishing puzzle with part of the plot revealed for every mini-chapter you complete, which was neat. The inventory is good; each item tells you if it can be combined, which saves you a lot of trouble of figuring out what goes with what.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is not a sequel of any previous Grim Legends as you may think. That’s another grim legend which is totally independent from the others.

You’re Sylvia, an apprentice and acolyte of an order which hunt down every demon from the world to make it safer. You’ve lost your memories in an accident that occurred some time ago and now you need to defeat a demon which have been located near a cathedral with the help of your mentor. Then will begin a chain of events that will lead to a very bad omen. The Incarceri Stone (a powerful artifact that binds Koshmaar, a horrifying creature from another world) will be stolen and the city of Lichtenheim as well as the world will be compromised. 

The bonus story let you play after the consequences of the main story. You’ll play as a male member of the order to save himself from the evil.

As every Artifex Mundi game you can move freely in different area (a Cathedral in the prologue and after in the Lichtenheim city) and need to solve some puzzles and find all objects in hidden objects scenes. The game has 3 difficulties and a guest feature: every one of the family can play an independent save and resume the game where they left it. When you first play the game you’ll have a notebook where you have all your objectives. Adding to that you’ll have a hint button that will help you in many ways but be warned that you may not use it in any puzzle or hidden object scene (HOS). Hints can be used to know where you need to go, where is the next interaction or to show an object in an HOS or to skip a puzzle. About the Hidden Objects Scenes, there are 3 different types: The one where you need to find objects with their name or with their shape or several items of the same kind. But in any of them you may encounter some blue text or red shaded shape that mean you’ll need to interact with the scene using or not an additional item of the scenery.

To conclude this part, you’ll also have an inventory to store useful items through your journey.
As some Artifex Mundi game, you’ll have some collectibles to find hidden through the sceneries: 30 skeleton dolls.

One of the very good thing of this game is that there are 7 unique features you won’t find in any other Artifex Mundi game:

⦁	Rune Battle mini-games
⦁	Memory Mirror mini-games
⦁	A smart combine or interact feature for some specific items
⦁	A “fake” 3D for some specific objects which you can interact and rotate the view to another side.
⦁	A few shooting parts (2 or 3 in total) when you need to shoot at the right time.
⦁	A few conversation parts (where you need to talk every topics)
⦁	A notebook free of notes! Only objectives, no notes about the story or events. (maybe because you are in a hurry so you can’t make a personal diary?)

When you’ll play through the main story you’ll need to fight possessed people: to fight them you’ll play a rune mini-game. The runes in the red circle represents your enemy’s runes and the blue yours. Runes come in a set of two runes: you need to select the set of runes which your opponent haven’t got in order to hurt him/her. You’ll need to make 3 successful attempts in order to make him/her pass out. But these mini-games aren’t that challenging as you have all the time you want to select the right set.

After he/she passed out, you’ll need to look at the attached mirror and “fix” their memories. Each Memory Mirror game have 3 progressive steps and each Memory Mirror have their own rules. One is rotating some circles, another is swapping tiles, another is sliding tiles… When you succeeded to go through their memory you’ll be able to lift the curse on them and take away their cursed mask.

As I said earlier you’ll find several items where you’ll be able to interact with in your inventory. They are marked with a white plus in a green circle. When you click at them you zoom in the item. Some items need only to be combined with another or several items to have the final item.  And some other items can be interacted with in order to solve them. These last items are most likely in a fake 3D, meaning that you can rotate them in another view.

Finally the game has a few shooting parts where you need to shoot at the right time:  the cross will move around the target and you’ll need to shoot when you’re in range with it.

 (*) : 
In addition to no skip or use any hint while playing every puzzles and Hidden objects scenes, there are more missable achievements. I won’t list them all but I’ll talk about some of the main one.  

There are collectibles or interactions achievements : skeleton dolls and reading texts.
There are at least two achievements that ask you to no skip any cut scene.
There are achievements that requires a perfect without any limit of time : “False Positive” and most of the Rune Battle mini-games.

There are the Memory Mirror achievements that need you to finish each of them within 3 minutes.
So I strongly suggest you to follow a guide on steam especially if you don’t really wish to make a second playthrough.

Finally if you missed anything while finishing your first playthrough, you’ll need to play the game again with or without the same profile. The good thing is you only need to succeed where you failed to get the achievements left. This is true for the skeleton dolls if you restart a new game with your same profile and it also may be true for some others too !

24263651.review:
Artifex Mundi hat es wieder einmal geschafft! 
Nach den Blockbustern Grimmige Legenden 1 und 2 könnte man denken, dass den Entwicklern der kreative Saft ausgegangen ist. Doch entgegen der Erwartung führen die Designer wieder in eine Welt voll von Mysterien und Magie, gespickt mit gefährlichen Monstern und Familen- und Liebesdramen.

Art-Design: Den Art-Designern, eigentlich könnte man sie Künstler nennen, ist es gelungen, eine sowohl lebendige, bedrohliche als auch abwechslungreiche Fantasywelt zu gestalten. Die 36 handgemalten Umgebungen überzeugen durch Qualität und Detailreichtum. Man erwischt sich öfters dabei, dass man atemlos vor dem Bildschirm sitzt und jene bewundert.

Level-Desing: Wie bei jedem Artifex-Mundi-Titel folgt man einer linearen Story. Dabei frischen die zahlreichen Rätsel und die fast ständigen Themenwechseln in der Gestaltung der Spielwelt das Spielerlebnis auf und sorgen für einen konstanten Spannungsbogen.

Story: Man nimmt die Rolle einer Monsterjägerin, namens Sylvia, an, die es sich zur Aufgabe gemacht hat, die Welt vom Bösen zu befreien. Nachdem sie auf unergründliche Weise ihr Gedächtnis verloren hat, findet sich der Spieler zusammen mit Sylvia unwissend in die düstere, vom Koshmaar bedrohten Welt geworfen wieder. Schritt für Schritt entschlüsselt man das Mysterium úm den Orden, das Koshmaar und Slyvias Vergangenheit. Versüßt durch 3D-animierte Cut-Scenes, herausragendem Voice-Acting und diversen Plot-Twists bleibt die Handlung bis zum Ende fesselnd und interessant. Dies bezieht sich nicht nur auf die Hauptgeschichte, sondern geht auch auf das nachfolgende Bonuskapitel über, in dem man, in die Rolle Sylvias Bruders, Gabriel, versetzt, versucht, dem Koshmaar ein für alle Male den Garaus zu machen.

Gameplay: In typischer "Grimmige Legenden"-Manier liegt der Fokus nicht nur auf der Story, sondern auch auf den Rätseln. So gibt es einen weitreichenden Pool an Denkaufgaben, von Schieberätseln zu Wimmelbildern (ANFÄNGER AUFGEPASST: Teilweise muss man bereits gelöst Wimmelbilder erneut besuchen!) ist jeder Puzzle-Begeisteter bedient. Wenn man es dann noch schafft diese abwechslungsreich, fordern, aber auch gleichzeitig anfängerfreundlich zu gestallten, wie es die Macher von "Grimmige Legenden 3" taten, hat man ein Meisterwerk entwickelt. Das ist jedoch nicht alles!
Durch die Implementierung eines "Kampfsystems" wurde das Gameplay um eine weitere Ebene sinnvoll erweitert. Zudem wird es einerseits gestattet, Dialoge zu führen und andererseits, à la Telltale-Produktion Entscheidungen zu fällen, die das Spielgeschehen nachträglich bestimmen. 

Sound-Design: Das Spiel bietet in allen Situationen die passende musikalische Untermalung. Herausstechend ist hierbei das Battle-Themen, welches das Blut durch mitreißende Rhythmik zum Kochen bringt und den Adrenalinspiegel steigen lässt. 
Gänsehaut vorprogrammiert! 

Um dem ReVIEW noch mal ReVUE passieren zu lassen: Fans der "Grimmigen Legenden"-Serie beziehungsweise Fans von qualitativ hochwertigen Spielen im Allgemeinen werden Grimmige Legenden 3 als würige Ergänzung zu den vorherigen Teilen und dem Artifex-Mundi-Universum sehen. 

"Grimmige Legenden 3: Die Dunkele Stadt" bekommt eine bedenkenlose Kaufempfehlung!

It's a bit saddening for me to not recommend this game, especially since the Grim Legends saga has proven itself a favorite of mine. I believe that playing the previous games made my expectations grow, yet the third installment could only grant me frustration.

I can't precisely point out what, in The Dark City, is responsible for my lack of enjoyment/enthusiasm -- it's all just a big "meh". Perhaps it just didn't feel like "Grim Legends" at all... Its vibe is raw, unfinished, shallow. The game also seems to be shorter than the previous two, with a 2 hours difference when it comes to completion.

I can't complain about the art, the design or the soundtrack -- these have always been Artifex Mundi's highlights, IMO. However, the puzzles and minigames are not as challenging nor as intuitive as the first and second games, respectively; the first two Grim Legends were absolutely brilliant and fun to play, challenging and exciting, beautiful and with a really nice atmosphere. 

I wish I could say the same about Grim Legends 3: The Dark City.

5/10

23622299.review:
Playing [i]Grim Legends 3: The Dark City[/i] was a very interesting experience. This is the third installment in the [i]Grim Legends[/i] series, but none of the three games are connected. It’s actually very far removed from the other two, which were set in worlds of fantasy, like out of a storybook while this game has a more gothic feel and could easily be set in the real world. That aside, it’s a great game filled with lots of hidden object scenes and puzzles to keep players busy.

You take the role of a demon hunter named Sylvia who is apart of a secret organization called The Order. The game is filled with its own vocabulary as the different monsters have strange names and history behind them. The basics aren’t hard to grasp, The Order keeps magical stones with evil spirits locked inside of them but one ends up being stolen. Sylvia and her mentor go to find it but discover that it’s already been used and a town has been dragged into demonic chaos. The story revolves around saving those possessed by demons, finding the stone and sealing away the evil once more. There are some interesting twists and turns, a love story, and a mystery to solve as Sylvia lost her memory a year ago and works to recover it. There are a lot of different elements at play but the story is woven together very well.

As with most games in this genre, you use your mouse to control things; clicking on people and objects to interact with them as well as solving puzzles. The game has amazing hidden object scenes that offer a decent level of challenge as do the puzzles. It’s a good game for beginners and veterans of this genre alike. One thing I enjoyed were the items in the game that required further examination, you get to zoom on an item and figure how it works or what it needs, like unscrewing a rocket to get the gun powder out. Another fun feature are the magic battles you have to win in order to help return a possessed person back to their human state. They require finding a rune that doesn’t match any on the enemy’s side and as the game progresses they become more challenging. There are also hidden collectables in the game.

The artwork in this game is top notch, to the point where you might not even suspect it was a hidden object game. The setting, the cutscenes, and character models all feel like they’re out of an adventure game. I dare say this game reminded me of an [i]Assassin’s Creed[/i] title. All of the hidden object scenes are beautiful and don’t strain the eyes, the characters move very smoothly and every cutscene is gorgeous. Audio-wise the voice acting is also well done and of high quality. I can’t complain about the background music and sound effects.

[i]Grim Legends 3: The Dark City[/i] is amazing and I can’t really say anything negative about it other than the fact that this could have easily been a standalone title instead of part of the [i]Grim Legend[/i] series. This game offers a great challenge, it’s beautiful and, most importantly, fun. There are Steam achievements and trading cards to collect plus a bonus chapter that adds completion to the story. If you’re a fan of hidden object games you need this game in your library, if you’re not a fan this game could very well change your mind.

[url=http://lunarproductions.tumblr.com/]Lunar Productions[/url]

23486762.review:
Grim Legends 3 is a very well made hidden object casual adventure game. There are quite a few points that I'd like to mention though.

First of all I'd like to say that while this game has a very intense and interesting atmosphere it simply doesn't fit well in the Grim Legends series. The fairytale theme from the first two games is completely gone and this just feels odd as the third part of that series. That doesn't make the game any less fun to play though.

The presentation is great and almost as good as in the first Grim Legends game. There are a few scenes when the characters aren't 3D rendered and instead use the moving 2D image technique that don't look great. This being sad most of the game just looks fantastic and especially the animation is really well done. The music and voice acting is flawless and both fit the atmosphere of the game very well.

The story is interesting and quite dark. Both the pacing of and the few twists in the story are great. I'd say that the story is one of the best in any Artifex Mundi game.

The mini-games are at last not repetitions of the same mini-games in older Artifex Mundi games. All the mini-games feel new and for the most part are very well made. Sadly the hidden object scenes aren't as amazing as in other Artifex Mundi titles and for my taste there were too many FROGs and 'find x of the same item' kind of scenes. Still those parts of the game are fun and don't ruin the game.

The last thing I'd like to mention is that some of the achievements in this game are quite hard to get. This isn't bad, but the one that requires you to finish a hidden object scene in under 20 seconds might be a bit too harsh. I had to replay the game a few times to memorize one scene and then execute it perfectly to get that achievement.

Overall it's a great game and I can recommend it even for the full price. If you really liked the fairytale scenario of the first two games and don't like darker scenarios though, you might want to wait for a sale.

23479745.review:
解谜类游戏玩过不少，Artifex公司的作品，算上这次的恐怖传奇3，玩过有5-6部了。
先说优点：
①自带中文，绝对是良心，但是有的地方翻译的有些瑕疵。
②画面和声音制作的都不错，比较精美。
③适合各种人群，无论是自己泡一杯茶消磨时间，或者朋友爱人坐在一起研究谜题，都是很不错的选择。
再说缺点：
①抛开剧情不谈，整体流程偏短，老司机在最高难度下几个小时就能通关，新手也不会花费很长时间。
②完全是针对Artifex公司，希望你们能给玩家些新的感觉，旗下所有的解密游戏都像是一个模子里出来的，只不过石头变成了花瓶，玫瑰变成了手杖等等。虽然是不同的游戏，但玩起来的感觉几乎没有任何区别，希望在这一点能有提升，让每个系列的作品，都充满自己的特色和玩法。
总而言之这款解谜游戏，我个人还是非常推荐的。而且还经常有折扣，趁着折扣的时候入手，在假期或者休息的时候，用几个小时通关游戏，活跃一下大脑，何乐而不为呢。

23457881.review:
I struggled with whether or not I should give this game an up or down, I don't actively hate the game, and I did enjoy some of the puzzles as well as the sound in the game... But I don't feel the game has so much charm as the previous ones, and some parts of the game annoyed me a lot.

The story doesn’t really match the relaxed gameplay at all, and I think it fits an action game or an RPG a bit better. It felt a bit too action packed for a point and click adventure game’s slow exploration and problem solving gameplay. If there was one thing I certainly didn’t want the series to add it was any sort of fighting mechanic. Which they have done through putting up a mini-game for spell shields. 

The characters seem a bit more complex than previously, even if the story is still easy to follow. This time we get to see the female protagonist multiple times throughout the game, as the cut scenes can’t decide if they want to be in first person or third person, even if the game outside is in first person. Which I don’t think really work for an adventure game when the character has a backstory and preexisting relationships in the story.

It is visually pleasing. The game doesn’t really have any things that are directly harmful, so if you think it looks interesting you should buy it. It does seem like attention and love has been put into the game, I just don’t think the various things match up all that well. As for me, I am glad I bought the three games in a bundle, rather than buying this alone as I had originally considered.

Bastante bien, no es difícil ni supone ningún reto, pero es muy entretenido y está bien de duración. La historia está bastante bien trabajada, no es lo de siempre, con giro inesperado incluido y con un buen capítulo extra.

23431076.review:
Sylvia is a member of a secret order, guarding Incarcerati Stones and protecting the world from Koshmaar. However, she lost her memory one year ago. With Solomon, her master, she goes to Lichtenheim, where a thief is hiding with a stone. However, why Gabriel, a former member, would have used it? And why is Sylvia feeling that this is related to her?

Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is as any Artifex Mundi developed game a true gem in terms of story. You don't know who you are really and the more you're learning about Gabriel and Solomon, the more you're feeling it's relating to you. Even the way to discover why the people possessed by the Koshmaar is interesting: memories of their involvements are told by solving different minigames, all pictures of their stories.

In terms of gameplay, everything is simple: you take items, you use them, you combine them, you clear hidden objects scenes (whether it's a list of words or a silhouette-shaped mechanism), you solve puzzles. Nothing is really extraordinary there, apart the way to save people as explained above. I've a great regret: the prologue showed a very interesting way to play: formulate a plan by looking and clicking on items/persons of interests. It's the only time it's used. Contrary to 9 Clues or Enigmatis, which are using specific mechanisms several times, Grim Legends 3 is void of this. However, you'll have to defend yourself against the possessed people by using magic. To win, you need to find the only pair of symbols not represented on the enemy side.

Graphics are really good, as usual. However, I feel like the team was influenced by Assassin's Creed, given how the girl is moving in the beginning and the clothes. It's a Grim Legend game, meaning that you have dark stuff in it. But where the first two games were still colorful, here, you're really in a grim city, with rain, darkness, anything that can make feel like you're in a nightmare.

As usual, the soundtrack is marvelous. The tunes are really fitting the game.

But there is something unusual for Artifex Mundi, more if it's a game of their own: translations were badly handled. While it's not as catastrophic as in Princess Isabella, it's like they fired or stopped using people to check translations. Thanks god, there isn't much hidden objects scenes with words but even there, you have real problems: since when a coat of arms, which is translated in French by "blason", is a "bras", which is an arm? I was searching for the part of the body, not for a coat of arms... And apparently, the other languages are also posing problems. I wouldn't mind playing it in English only, as apparently, it's one of the rare languages that are checked.

Artifex Mundi, if you begin to get on the slippy road of not checking your translations, you have to know that many people will be disappointed. Grim Legends 3 is one of my favorite games from you, It's awesome. But there is also a level above awesome and the game would have reached it in my book... if the translations weren't badly handled.

As it's a collector's edition, you'll find bonus like a bonus chapter as Gabriel after the end of the main story, with also a pseudo-choice of how to end the story (it's only mattering for achievements), concept art, music, etc...

So, is Grim Legends a good choice? It's an awesome game. But you should perhaps choose to play it in English if you don't want to be disappointed by your native language. Grim Legends 3: The Dark City is a real must-have, despite these translations problems. I do hope that Artifex Mundi will realize that they need to be more thorough when it comes to them....

23409280.review:
一进去就是惊喜，画面炸裂，好看，人物模型比以前更真了。虽然诡异的女侍卫头像有些奇怪，但鉴于她只不过是出场一幕的小配角，我们可以忽略。然后谜题也都不错，有条有理，不会出现那种没头没尾乱跑找寻物点的情况，是一张地图一张地图推进的，很棒。当然理所当然的依然是白烂的剧情什么大家都有苦衷什么为了爱人亲人毁灭世界什么的身边的人有隐瞒你一些事情什么的……说起来解谜游戏也开始失忆梗了呢，失忆梗果然好用啊~失忆前做了什么事都是有可能的，于是主角就要怀着这种我不会自己是反派吧麻蛋之类的心理惴惴不安上路惹~
然后主角依然是女性，依然会出现那种我就不手撕我就要找刀子然后用完刀子随手乱丢之类的矫情寻物~唉这些大家都习惯了啦~哪次主角乖乖的把小刀子留身上了那我们玩啥啊~
剧情最想吐槽的当然是女主角假扮卡米拉哈哈哈哈哈哈哈，站在镜子前女主喃喃自语什么“我和卡米拉其实有些像”的时候，脑海中疯狂飞出无数弹幕啊hhhhh笑死人了。我知道你们都是美女啦，但是拜托卡米拉是娇贵小姐型的你是古墓丽影型的好么！你看看你那古铜色的健美肤色，你再看看人比花娇白嫩嫩粉嘟嘟的卡米拉画像~你是要在卡、米、拉、妈、妈面前假扮她好么!到底谁给了你这样的自信穿上卡米拉的衣服她妈妈就会相信你是卡米拉啊哈哈哈哈！
结果剧情神反转啊哈哈哈，我还以为会强行认不出来，果然编剧都觉得无法说服自己了是么？卡米拉妈妈果然认出来了……然后女主角跟她打了一架把事情解决了……！！！！拜托啦！！！你能打得过干嘛要打扮得花里胡哨的啊！？果然其实是女主角自己想玩换装游戏吧摔~说起来到处找卡米拉大小姐的衣服我们也很辛苦的好么！为了假扮卡米拉女主角还亲手缝了个假发诶！！！你想想现实世界里你缝个假发完回来估计你哥早和卡米拉跑没边了没准世界都毁灭了~卡米拉妈妈装作被骗一下都不行么？一眼就认出来了真是一点面子都不给啊~心疼女主三秒钟。
还有一个槽点在于中文翻译……这也是老毛病了……但这次更加过分！以前顶多是翻译的时候英文是多义词，造成中文变成另一个单词，这次呢！！！那么多错别字你是要闹哪样！审核也太敷衍了吧！这根本不是多义词的问题了，字幕对话中都有好多错字，纯粹是手癌啊！这锅没法丢，希望改进吧。
不过值得一提的是这次游戏的收藏物超可爱，是小骷髅，也超级容易找，因为都不会藏在大场景里的，都是藏在要点开的小场景里，稍微注意看一下就能找到了。开心~女主长得也好看，动画看起来更加自如了，动画里面人物上蹿下跳违和感大大减弱，这点绝对值得夸奖！猛地一看有种要融为一体的错觉了呢！
这部可以说最大的亮点就是画面和合理的剧情推进节奏了。总的来说绝对是水准之作，还是喜欢喜欢喜欢，21买到不亏~

23400993.review:
Four years ago I played my first Artifex Mundi game called "Nightmares from the Deep: The Cursed Heart" and I've been playing their game ever since. The Dark City is the third installment in the popular Grim Legends series and provides a memorable story, interesting characters, and pleasing art style. The background music throughout the game has highs and lows that move with the action. The battle game mechanic with escalating challenge was entertaining to play rather than being repetitive and dull. 
 
I've played (and recorded) over 300 HOPA games and can say that The Dark City delighted me from start to finish. To see this game show up as a new release on Steam is an exciting opportunity for HOPA developers and I appreciate that Artifex Mundi has been pushing hard to make it happen. The Steam version is what you would expect with Steam Achievements and Collector Cards and interwoven with the Steam background program. The missing "Strategy Guide" was not a major disappointment for me as I rarely refer to them but I can see how that would be an issue for some.

Congratulations to Artifex Mundi for another great release!

Il terzo episodio della serie grim legends era tanto atteso, la demo in circolazione mesi addietro, i consigli di tanti giocatori, e mesi di perfezionamento hanno permesso agli sviluppatori di confezionare quello che secondo me, amici, si definisce autentico capolavoro, il migliore di Artifex Mundi e forse, uno dei migliori giochi di questo genero mai usciti fino ad oggi.
Un lavoro eccellente, curato sotto ogni aspetto. Viene quasi voglia di scendere in campo insieme all'eroina Sylvia del gioco e combattere questa guerra nell'ordine della luce contro questi demoni oscuri.
Purtroppo , amici italiani di Steam, mi darete ragione, l'unico grande neo del gioco è la traduzione in italiano, che il piu' delle volte difetta. Molte frasi nei dialoghi sono state mal tradotte, sembra abbiano usato un programma di traduzione automatico, mentre dovevano rivolgersi a un team di esperti per le traduzioni.
Peccato per le traduzioni difettose, ma perdoniamo questa mancanza, perchè questo gioco, amici di steam, è una vera bomba, è strafighissimo per intenderci. BUON DIVERTIMENTO.

23369617.review:
Wiedermal ein Fest für Fantasy-Freunde… :)

… ist Artifex Mundi mit deren dritten Teil der Reihe gelungen! Jeder Teil ist in sich abgeschlossen, daher sind keine Vorkenntnisse nötig – ABER es lohnt sich sehr, auch die Vorgänger zu spielen… Wir sind als Monsterjägerin Sylvia in einer düsteren Welt unterwegs und müssen einen entflohenen, sogenannten Koshmaar besiegen, der sündige Menschen in Maskengeister verwandelt… Ganz grandios ist hier die Grafik! Die Schauplätze, die Figuren und auch die Zwischensequenzen haben mich restlos begeistert!! Die Geschichte ist spannend gemacht und hat so manche überraschende Wendung auf Lager…

FAKTEN: Eine gute Länge hat das 6 Kapitel umfassende Hauptspiel, das scheinbar abgeschlossen endet… Aber es geht im Bonus-Kapitel weiter und das sollte man sich nicht entgehen lassen! Am Ende des Bonus-Kapitels hat man auch noch die Wahl aus 2 verschiedenen Endungen… Gespielt habe ich im benutzerdefinierten Modus, in welchem man sämtliches Glitzern und das Tutorial abwählen kann. Der Tipp ist richtungsweisend, es gibt eine Aufgabenliste und die Transport-Karte zeigt zuverlässig, wo was zu tun ist – allerdings ist die Karte eigentlich überflüssig, denn die Inventargegenstände kommen logisch und zeitnah zum Einsatz und pro Kapitel sind die Einsatzorte überschaubar – außerdem ist es einfach so schön, sich überall genauer umzusehen!

Gaaanz wunderbar gestaltete WIMMELBILDER werden – teils auch 2-Mal – gelöst: Neben Wortsuchlisten gibt es Fragment-Suchen und wir finden eine bestimmte Anzahl von ähnlichen Gegenständen. 

Das MINISPIELE-Angebot beinhaltet alle Schwierigkeitsgrade und machen großen Spaß: Falsch Liegendes wird richtig eingesetzt. Ein Mosaik wird eingefärbt, ohne dass gleiche Farben nebeneinander liegen dürfen. Es werden alle Punkte über Linien aktiviert, ohne einen Punkt mehrmals zu benutzen. Eine Art Sudoku mit verschiedenartigen Augen wird gelöst. Flüssigkeiten werden abgemessen, indem sie in unterschiedlich großen Messbechern hin und her geschüttet werden. Schön sind auch ein paar 3-dimensionale Puzzles, die man per Pfeil drehen kann! Dazu verteidigen wir uns einige Male gegen dunkle Mächte mit einem  „Runen finden“-Spiel. Und nachdem wir einen der Maskengeister besiegt haben, erfahren wir jeweils dessen Geschichte mittels verschiedener Varianten von „Kacheln verschieben oder vertauschen“.

EXTRAS: 30 nette, kleine Skelett-Püppchen sind in den Nahansichten versteckt und können leider nicht mehr nachträglich gesucht werden – also aufpassen! Etliche Auszeichnungen können errungen werden. Außerdem noch wiederspielbare WB und Minispiele, der sehr schöne Soundtrack, Videos, Hintergrundbilder und Konzept-Kunst (das Lösungsbuch gibt es nur in der Bfg-Fassung!).

Ein wahrhaft FANTASTISCHES Abenteuer mit unglaublichen Schauplätzen – und wunderbaren Aufgaben erwartet euch!!! Ich MUSS es gleich nochmal spielen um rauszufinden, wie das alternative Ende des Bonus-Kapitels verlaufen wäre… Wer Fantastisches liebt und/ oder die Grim Legends Reihe kennt, der kann dieses Spiel „blind“ kaufen!! Versprochen… :)

Weitere Spiele aus dieser Serie:
1 – Der Fluch der Braut
2 – Das Lied des schwarzen Schwans
